alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 12:44PM EST until December 24 at 4:17PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire and Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll, and Oxford Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters surround properties across Transvale Acres. Flood waters 1 to 2 feet deep in sections of east bank camping areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 10.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
